thread.title: Ángel Di María strikes twice as four-star PSG dismantle Barcelona | Football
thread.title_full: Ángel Di María strikes twice as four-star PSG dismantle Barcelona | Football | The Guardian

author: theguardian.com
title: Ángel Di María strikes twice as four-star PSG dismantle Barcelona | Football
text:
Paris Saint-Germain’s Ángel Di María was at his vintage best as he scored twice on his birthday in a 4-0 demolition of Barcelona in their Champions League last 16 first leg.
The Argentina winger, 29, scored in each half with PSG’s Germany midfielder Julian Draxler and the Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani also finding the net as the French champions tore apart a disorganised Barcelona side who have it all to do in the return.
PSG, eliminated by Barça in the Champions League quarter-finals in 2013 and 2015, were the more aggressive side at the Parc des Princes and have put themselves in a commanding position before the 8 March second leg at the Camp Nou.
The five-times European champions Barcelona have not gone out in the last 16 since losing to Liverpool in the 2006‑07 season.
More to follow.
